topic.name: Technical Textiles & Papers
topic.description: 13-year academic progression (K-12) for Technical Textiles & Papers in Design & Technology

objectives.objective_text: Identify a printer making a picture.
Name a stamp or stencil.
Identify registration marks (targets on the corner).
Identify weaving (over-under).
Name knitting (loops).
Identify Cotton (t-shirt) and Wool (sweater).
Name a sheep as a source of wool.
Identify Polyester and Nylon.
Identify thin paper (writing) and thick card (cereal box).
Name cardboard.
Identify Corrugated Board.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Smart Materials (thermochromic, photochromic, shape memory alloys)
objectives.objective_text: Identify a spoon that changes color in hot food.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Smart Materials (thermochromic, photochromic, shape memory alloys)
objectives.objective_text: Name sunglasses that get dark outside.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Smart Materials (thermochromic, photochromic, shape memory alloys)
objectives.objective_text: Identify uses for color-changing thermometers.
Recall that machines cut shapes.
Observe a pop-up book.
Recall that felt is pressed together.
Observe a hole in jeans (seeing the threads).
Recall that some clothes are made by machines.
Observe smooth vs. fuzzy fabric.
Recall that paper rips easily.
Observe corrugated cardboard (wavy middle).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Smart Materials (thermochromic, photochromic, shape memory alloys)
objectives.objective_text: Recall that 'Smart' means it changes.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Smart Materials (thermochromic, photochromic, shape memory alloys)
objectives.objective_text: Observe a light-up shoe.
Make a simple felt sample.
Summarize CMYK (Cyan, Magenta, Yellow, Black).
Explain Die Cutting (like a cookie cutter).
Explain Flexography.
Defend the design of a net for die cutting efficiency.
Summarize Weaving (Warps and Wefts).
Explain why knitted fabric stretches (t-shirts).
Explain the selvage edge.
Defend the choice of construction for performance wear.
Summarize Natural fibers (plant/animal) vs. Synthetic (chemical).
Explain Cotton, Wool, and Silk.
Explain Regenerated fibers (Viscose/Rayon).
Defend the use of technical fibers (Kevlar, Nomex).
Summarize GSM (Grams per Square Meter).
Explain why we use card for packaging.
Explain laminated boards (Tetra Pak).
Defend the choice of substrate for printing.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Smart Materials (thermochromic, photochromic, shape memory alloys)
objectives.objective_text: Summarize Thermochromic (heat change) and Photochromic (light change).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Smart Materials (thermochromic, photochromic, shape memory alloys)
objectives.objective_text: Explain Shape Memory Alloy (Nitinol - remembers its shape).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Smart Materials (thermochromic, photochromic, shape memory alloys)
objectives.objective_text: Explain Hydrochromic ink.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Smart Materials (thermochromic, photochromic, shape memory alloys)
objectives.objective_text: Defend the integration of smart materials in safety equipment.
Compare home printing with book printing.
Analyze Offset Lithography (oil and water don't mix).
Interpret the function of a Crease vs. a Cut line.
Connect screen printing to mass production.
Compare a basket weave with a sweater.
Analyze the structure of Plain, Twill, and Satin weaves.
Interpret the drape of different constructions.
Connect non-woven fabrics to disposable medical use.
Compare warm wool with cool cotton.
Analyze the microscopic structure of fibers (scales on wool).
Interpret the reasons for blending fibers (Poly-cotton).
Connect fiber properties to garment care.
Compare tracing paper with printer paper.
Analyze the difference between Paper (<200gsm) and Board (>200gsm).
Interpret micron units for thickness.
Connect ply-count to board strength.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Smart Materials (thermochromic, photochromic, shape memory alloys)
objectives.objective_text: Compare a normal material with a smart one.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Smart Materials (thermochromic, photochromic, shape memory alloys)
objectives.objective_text: Analyze the input (stimulus) and output (response) of smart materials.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Smart Materials (thermochromic, photochromic, shape memory alloys)
objectives.objective_text: Interpret the use of Phosphorescent pigments.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Smart Materials (thermochromic, photochromic, shape memory alloys)
objectives.objective_text: Connect Piezoelectric crystals to generating sparks.
Evaluate the durability of woven vs. knitted textiles.
Evaluate the environmental impact of cotton (water) vs. polyester (oil).
Evaluate the structural integrity of folding box board.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Smart Materials (thermochromic, photochromic, shape memory alloys)
objectives.objective_text: Evaluate the functional longevity of smart properties.
Construct a sample of varied fabric constructions using basic weave patterns.
Construct a print-ready file with bleed and crop marks.
Synthesize graphic design with production processes.
Synthesize structural mechanics of textiles.
Construct a textile selection justification.
Synthesize material properties with end-use requirements.
Construct a packaging prototype with appropriate board weight.
Synthesize weight specifications with cost and function.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Smart Materials (thermochromic, photochromic, shape memory alloys)
objectives.objective_text: Construct a prototype utilizing a smart material sensor.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Smart Materials (thermochromic, photochromic, shape memory alloys)
objectives.objective_text: Synthesize material science with electronic control.
Evaluate the economics of digital vs. offset printing.
